creditline: The Sharon and Bill Richardson Endowment for Art Acquisition
description: man wearing small leopard-print bikini pants, with Band-Aids on his face, holding a pink bowling ball in each hand; man stands in front of a dark red curtain
signed: on back, in pencil: [X. Tavera II  El Mas Fuerte  El Circo Series]
text: Part of the series “El Circo,” these photographs capture the circus’ wonder and fantasy through three exotic characters.  These “characters,” who are in fact the artist’s friends, pose for a large format camera in front of colorful sets that the artist has constructed and painted to complement the figures.  In “Dama Tatuada” the pattern on the curtain backdrop blends with the woman’s tattoo; in “El Mas Fuerte” the muscle man’s two red bowling balls match a deep red curtain backdrop; and in “Domadora de Caballos” a young girl with a pale blue shirt sits in front of a backdrop with a pale blue sky.  Each figure performs for the viewer, suggesting different states of magic and possibility.
title: El Mas Fuerte (The Strongest One)
